dcterms:creator: Y. Lecun
L. Bottou
Y. Bengio
P. Haffner
dcterms:description: The MNIST dataset is a collection of handwritten digits used for training various image processing systems. It consists of 60,000 training images and 10,000 testing images, each of size 28x28 pixels.
dcterms:title: MNIST Dataset

dcterms:creator: D. Martin
C. Fowlkes
D. Tal
J. Malik
dcterms:description: The Berkeley Segmentation Dataset (BSDS) is a collection of natural images that have been manually segmented into regions. It is used for evaluating segmentation algorithms and measuring ecological statistics.
dcterms:title: Berkeley Segmentation Dataset (BSDS)

dcterms:creator: R. Wang
X. Chen
dcterms:description: The Swiss Roll Dataset is a synthetic dataset used for testing manifold learning algorithms. It consists of points sampled from a 2D manifold that is rolled into a 3D space.
dcterms:title: Swiss Roll Dataset

dcterms:creator: R. Wang
X. Chen
dcterms:description: The S-Curve Dataset is another synthetic dataset used for testing manifold learning algorithms. It consists of points sampled from a 2D S-curve manifold embedded in a 3D space.
dcterms:title: S-Curve Dataset
